meanings.definition: The supporting framework underneath a vehicle.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic inspected the undercarriages of the car for any damage.
meanings.sent2: The undercarriages of the truck were sturdy and well-built.
meanings.sent3: As the car drove over a bump, the undercarriages giggled.
meanings.sent4: The undercarriages of the vehicle were the backbone of its structure.
meanings.sent5: The undercarriages of the bus were like a hidden fortress protecting its passengers.

meanings.definition: The landing gear of an aircraft.
meanings.sent1: The pilot checked the undercarriages before takeoff to ensure a safe flight.
meanings.sent2: The undercarriages of the plane smoothly retracted after liftoff.
meanings.sent3: The undercarriages of the airplane had a dance party during turbulence.
meanings.sent4: The undercarriages of the aircraft were like legs ready to touch the sky.
meanings.sent5: The undercarriages of the jet were crucial for a smooth landing.

meanings.definition: The lower part of a structure or machine.
meanings.sent1: The undercarriages of the crane provided stability during construction.
meanings.sent2: The undercarriages of the lawnmower were covered in grass clippings.
meanings.sent3: The undercarriages of the robot decided to take a nap.
meanings.sent4: The undercarriages of the building were like roots firmly planted in the ground.
meanings.sent5: The undercarriages of the machine hummed with power as it operated.
